intro: Polygonatum hondoense, commonly known as Hondo snake root, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its rhizomatous growth habit. The plant produces clusters of small, greenish-white flowers in early summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and arranged in a spiral pattern along the stem. Polygonatum hondoense is often found in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions.
